contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, I hear we're going to have sweltering daytime temperatures tomorrow, but rain is back in store for us overnight? Tell us the details.

Sure, Conn-young. Most heatwave alerts have been lifted but advisories are still in effect in Daegu, Gyeongsangbuk-do Province and parts of Gangwon-do Province. In these areas, temperatures are projected to exceed 33 degrees Celsius. So make sure to stay hydrated.

The daytime UV ray index will increase to very high levels all across the nation, so make sure to wear plenty of sunblock.

With high levels of humidity, rising temperatures during the day will make the atmosphere unstable and cause rain showers. Rain is back in forecast starting on Jeju Island and in southern parts of the nation tomorrow. By Saturday, rain will have spread nationwide.

For tomorrow, Seoul, Gwangju and Busan will begin the day at 21 degrees Celsius.

In the daytime, highs will hover around 30 degrees for most areas. Busan and Jeju will be a bit cooler at 26 degrees.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will see highs of 31 degrees with some sporadic rain during the daytime.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Heat to continue tomorrow; heatwave alerts still in place
Updated: 2020-06-11 17:10:30 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, we had soupy start to the day and southern parts of the country are likely to be hot and humid all day with a chance of the southern inland regions seeing passing showers in the afternoon,

So temperatures in the south will be 2 to 5 degrees lower than yesterday but parts of Gyeongsanbuk-do Province and Daegu will see highs in the 30's under a heat wave advisory, while upper regions will be as hot and sunny as yesterday.

Seoul getting up to 32 degrees Celsius, Gyeongju 29, but Jeju will be rather cloudy at a high of 26 degrees.

The first round of heatwaves in the capital will ease, temperatures will return to the seasonal norms this weekend with nationwide rain in store. Jeju will see frequent showers.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Heat wave continues with spotty rain in southern inland regions
Updated: 2020-06-11 06:57:53 KST

contents.context:
Good morning, after another sweltering afternoon yesterday, it was nice to fall asleep with the sound of rain. Right now, the Gyeongsang-do Provinces and its neighboring regions are waking up to light rainfall but it should let up shortly.

So temperatures in the Gyeongsang-do Provinces will ease about 5 degrees lower but it will still be in 30's and under a heat wave advisory, while upper regions will be as hot as yesterday.

Morning lows in most parts are similar to slightly higher than yesterday Seoul and Chuncheon are waking up to a rather sunny Thursday morning and it will be sunny all day.

Meanwhile, there is a chance that southern inland regions will see passing showers in the afternoon, and even though the top readings will be a couple degrees lower down south, there will be higher humidity today so it will feel quite uncomfortable.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Sweltering day ahead for most parts
Updated: 2020-06-11 06:14:13 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, it was scorching hot in the capital today but I hear this heat will ease due to some rain. What's in store for us tomorrow?

Right, Conn-young. Showers started this afternoon on Jeju Island and in Jeolla-do Province and are gradually spreading throughout nation. In the capital, we’ll see less than 30 mm for tonight. The amount of precipitation in Chungcheong-do Province and the southern regions will be 30 to 70 mm, in mountainous areas of Jeju Island more than 100 mm of heavy rain is expected. Most of the rain will stop by tomorrow morning, but in southern regions, showers will continue for a bit longer.

But thanks to these showers, the sweltering heat should ease starting tomorrow. Temperatures will be cooling down a bit in the capital. For the weekend, the mercury will fall down to as low as 26 degrees Celsius in the daytime.

Tomorrow, most parts of the country will start off at 21 to 22 degrees.

In the daytime, Seoul will reach up to 31 degrees. In the south, we'll see cloudy spells after the rain.

For Korea's neighbors, Beijing and Tokyo will see rainy spells.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Rain to spread nationwide overnight…heatwave to ease
Updated: 2020-06-10 17:05:03 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, it was another sizzling day yesterday, making us wonder how hot it's going to be when summer really kicks in. Many parts had the season's hottest afternoon readings so far yesterday. However, southern parts of the country could see lower daytime highs today as rain clouds will move in later in the day.

The showers will start from Jeju around lunch time then spread northeast hitting Jeollanam-do Province next then gradually spread to most regions. It's monsoon rain for Jeju which comes about 15 days earlier than last year.

The further south you are, the more rain you will see. Up to 70 millimeters into tomorrow afternoon.

Seoul will see light rainfall around evening while readings will be in the thirties in most parts.

Frequent rain is in store for across the country, temperatures will cool down from Saturday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Blistering weather continues with monsoon rain on Jeju
Updated: 2020-06-10 10:05:52 KST

contents.context:
Good morning, Many parts had the season's hottest afternoon readings so far yesterday and heat wave advisory is in place across much of the country. However, southern parts of the country could see lower daytime highs today as rain clouds will move in later in the day.

The showers will start from Jeju around lunch time then spread northeast hitting Jeollanam-do Province next then gradually spread to most regions. It's monsoon rain for Jeju which comes about 15 days earlier than last year.

The further south you are, the more rain you will see. Up to 70 millimeters into tomorrow afternoon.

Morning lows in most parts are kicking off at 20 to 21 degrees Celsius under lots of sunshine so wear a good amount of sunblock and have your umbrella ready.

Seoul will see light rainfall around lunch time while readings will be in the thirties in most parts.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Sizzling day, monsoon rain starts in Jeju
Updated: 2020-06-10 05:55:52 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, today was sizzling hot, and we had heatwave alerts issued in many parts of the country.
I hear tomorrow will be scorching hot as well?

Right, Conn-young. Not only is it extremely hot in the daytime, but the nights are pretty stuffy as well. Heatwave conditions are set to prevail for a couple of days in many parts of the nation. The first heatwave advisory of the year was issued today in Seoul, and advisories are in effect in other inland areas including Jeolla-do, Chungcheong-do and Gangwon-do provinces. A heatwave warning was issued today in Gyeonsangbuk-do Province.

Some relatively early monsoon rain is set to arrive on Jeju island tomorrow. Showers will spread towards the southern parts of the country. In the latter half of the week, temperatures will cool down a bit.

Tomorrow, most parts of the country will start off at 20 to 21 degrees.

In the daytime, temperatures will be as hot as today's except for Gwangju and Jeju where there'll be showers, it will be cooler.

For Korea's neighbors, Beijing will be scorching hot at 35 degrees. In Tokyo, UV rays will be at extremely high levels, so for those in the area, avoid outdoor activites if possible.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Heatwave alert in many regions…Monsoon set to begin in Jeju
Updated: 2020-06-09 17:03:51 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, the season's first heat wave advisory has been issued in Seoul with Gyeongsan in Gyeongsangbuk-do Province under a heat wave warning.

Many inland regions will also see the hottest temperatures of the season so far this afternoon. Blistering sunshine and with us wearing our face masks, it will feel a lot hotter than the actual temperatures.

On a day like today, overexposure to hot temperatures can cause heat-related illnesses. If you feel nausea, aches or actually throw up, stop all activity, get into some shade and rest.

The heat will stay with us for the next few days. But some slight relief is on the way for the south. Rain is in store for Jeju and southern parts of the country from tomorrow. And this year's monsoon season could start at the end of the week beginning in Jeju.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

Many inland regions will also see the hottest temperatures of the season so far this afternoon. Blistering sunshine and with us wearing our face masks, it will feel a lot hotter than the actual temperatures.

On a day like today, overexposure to hot temperatures can cause heat-related illnesses. If you feel nausea, aches or actually throw up, stop all activity, get into some shade and rest.

The heat will stay with us for the next few days. But some slight relief is on the way for the south. Rain is in store for Jeju and southern parts of the country from tomorrow. And this year's monsoon season could start at the end of the week beginning in Jeju.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Season's first heat wave advisory issued in many inland regions
Updated: 2020-06-09 06:57:51 KST

contents.context:
Good morning, it was a scorcher yesterday with blistering hot sunshine walking around outside for just a few minutes sapped your energy. The sizzling heat wave continues with parts of Seoul now under a heat wave advisory. Gyeongsan in Gyeongsangbuk-do Province is under a heat wave warning.

It's a comfortable start to the day, lows in most parts at 20 degrees, but temperatures will rise rapidly along with plenty of sun.

Spending time outdoors during the day won't be easy with a face mask ondrink plenty of water and let's take it easy. Seoul will see a high a couple degrees higher at 33 degrees, Daejeon and Chuncheon at 34 degrees.

Rain is in store for Jeju and southern parts of the country. Monsoon season starts at the end of the week. In fact, it could be the earlier monsoon season on record. Meanwhile, the heat will ease from Thursday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Another blisteringly hot day ahead
Updated: 2020-06-09 05:59:35 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, we're only in the second week of June and we're already feeling the sweltering heat.
What's going on?

Right, Conn-young. Heatwave advisories have been extended to Jeollabuk-do and Gyeongsangbuk-do provinces as well as in most central regions, including the Seoul metropolitan area. This is the first heat alert issued in the capital this year. And as of 11am tomorrow, the advisory in Gyeongsangbuk-do Province will be intensified to a heatwave warning.

Amid these sunny spells, the amount of UV radiation will be significant. We'll be seeing 'very high' levels nationwide tomorrow. Under these conditions, Korea's Meteorological Administration advises you to avoid outdoor activities from 10 am to 3 pm, so please keep that in mind.

Tomorrow, Seoul and Daegu will begin the day at 20 degrees Celsius.

In the daytime, we can expect record-breaking temperatures. Seoul will reach up to 33 degrees and Daegu 35 degrees.

We have sweltering days ahead too as temperatures in the capital will stay at around 30 degrees for the week. Rain is in forecast this Wednesday starting on Jeju Island and will spread towards southern parts of the nation.

For Korea's neighbors, Beijing will reach up to 32 degrees with cloudy spells.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Heatwave advisories expanded to more areas, high UV ray index nationwide
Updated: 2020-06-08 17:07:41 KST
